intro: Parodiodoxa chionophila, commonly known as the snow-flower plant, is a member of the Berberidaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its attractive, waxy, white to pale green leaves that resemble small, rounded shields. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which appear in spring. It is native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia, including China and Korea. Parodiodoxa chionophila thrives in cool, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental foliage.
